ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: AC
ygData.msgSnippet: Here s My list... Head: Skull Shaped Barbute (ac 13, +10 vs magic, +35 hp) Neck: Collar of Undead Protection (ac 5, +7 vs disease, +7 vs poison) Face: Mask of
ygData.messageBody:
Here's My list...

Head: Skull Shaped Barbute (ac 13, +10 vs magic, +35 hp)
Neck: Collar of Undead Protection (ac 5, +7 vs disease, +7 vs poison)
Face: Mask of Deception (ac 4, +13 cha, +7 vs magic, effect: illusion dark
elf)
Ear1: Gold Topaz Earing (ac 3, +8 vs disease)
Ear2: Gold Topaz Earing (ac 3, +8 vs disease)

Chest: Lambent BP (ac 20, +5 sta, +1 cha, +25 hp)
Arms: Lambent Sleeves (ac 11, +2 vs all resistances, +1 cha)
Wrist1: Lambent Bracer (ac 9, +4 str, +1 cha)
Wrist2: Symbol of Loyalty to Vox (ac 7, +7 vs cold)
Gloves: Lambent Gauntlets (ac 12, +5 dex, +1 cha)
Finger1: Platinum Emerald Ring (ac 4, +10 vs fire)
Finger2: Platinum Emerald Ring (ac 4, +10 vs fire)

Shoulder: Crested Spaulders (ac 11, +6 sta)
Back: Cloak of the Ice Bear (ac 8, +10 hp, +20 vs cold)
Legs: Lambent Greaves (ac 13, +5 agi, +1 cha)
Feet: Lambent Boots (ac 11, +2 vs all resistances, +1 cha)
Waist: Troll Hide Belt (ac 5, +5 str, +5 sta)

Melee1: Obsidian Shard (6 damage, 25 delay, effect: obsidian shatter)
Silvery War Axe (6 damage, 22 dealy)
Melee2: Black Enameled Mace (8 damage, 28 delay)
Brazen Brass Kiliji (10 damage, 35 delay)
Ranged: Runed Bone Fork (5 damage, 29 delay, +10 vs magic, +10 vs Fire, +10
vs cold)

With this set up and Skin Like Diamond from my favorite Druid, I reach 808
ac. And I haven't maxed Defense yet either. I can increase that slightly by
subbing in Jagged Bands (an additional 2 ac)

I could also obtain some nicer ac items...
Thick Banded Belt (ac 8, +15 str) [lost a roll on this the other day. I
rolled 469 out of 500, the cleric rolled 483]
Mountain Death Belt (ac 8, +25 hp, 5 charges of skin like rock)
Lambent Bracer (ac 9, +4 str, +1 cha)
Hero Bracer (ac 9, +10 str, +5 vs disease, +5 vs poison)
Mithril Breastplate (ac 17, +15 agi, +30 hp) [I've been told that the +15
agi usually amounts to more ac than the Lambent BP has]

I think that all of the items on this list are obtainable by me. (I saw
someone trading Hero Bracers for a MM battle drum the other day. I should
have taken it, but I love my drum)

Draelon Stormsong
Bard of the Tribunal
40th level as well.

-----Original Message-----
From: Eric Boller [mailto:eboller@...]
Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 11:48 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: AC


OK, I'm curious--what is your equipment list? I'm an
ac hound and I do have AC belt, rings and ears and I
won't be able to get to 800 ac (after my defense is
maxed).

Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
40th level bard, Black Tower

>
> I understand that everyone likes to have high AC.
> And we can still get ours
> pretty damn high. And I'm not sure why you can't
> get your AC above 850. As
> it stands now, at level 40, mine is 803. And I
> don't have any Imbrued nor
> do I have an AC belt, AC Necklace, AC Rings, AC
> Ears. My cloak is a level
> 25 item (lizard scale) and my hat is AC 5. I could
> easily, if I were
> willing to give up some charisma and dex, crank my
> AC to around 900... at
> level 40... without a single piece of imbrued and
> only the singing steel
> boots. At level 40 it's hard, even for a warrior,
> to break the 800AC
> barrier. For a bard it's just as hard, but not
> impossible.
>
> So I guess my question is:
> Is it that you are envious of the warrior/paladin/sk
> AC or is it that you
> just want it to be easier to get over 900 AC?
>
> If you want high AC you have to do what warriors do,
> give up having high
> stats so that you get AC and strength.
>
> If you want high stats you're going to sacrifice AC.
>
> Just my 2 cents.
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur
> Bard of Norrath
